TextView.android:text: The home view displays all topics available from the server. You can sort them by selecting an option from the drop down menu (see: Sorting). Click on a topic that you are interested in to view its content and replies. You can start your own topic from the home view by pressing the plus button on the top bar. (See: Creating a Topic/Replying) You can view all the topics and comments you have favourited by pressing the star button on the top bar. (See: Favourites View)\n

The topic view displays the topic and all details associated with it (time posted, gps location, number of comments). You can also see all the comments that are replies to the topic and contribute with your own reply. From the topic view you can:

Edit the topic: You can edit the title, username, text, or even the location and image attachment of the topic.

Reply to the topic with a comment: Create a new comment with any username, attach a picture if you want, and reply to the topic.

Save it as a favourite: If you hit the “save” button, the topic will be saved in your favourites list and will be kept updated. (See: Favourites View).

Map the location of all the comments: Clicking “Map Thread” will display a map showing the location of all the comments in the topic.

Select a username: Clicking “Select Username” will allow you to set or edit usernames that you can use when making topics or comments.

When creating a topic or replying to a topic with a comment, you can choose your username, write text, give it a location, and attach a picture. If you’re creating a new topic, you can give it a title.\n

To sort items when viewing topics or comments, press the drop down menu and select one of the options available:


Relevant: this will display topics that are both new and close to you


Proximity to Me: this will display topics and comments closest to you


Proximity to Location: this will display topics and comments closest to a location of your choice


Pictures: this will display topics and comments closest to you that have pictures attached


Newest: this will display topics and comments in order of newest to oldest created


Oldest: this will display topics and comments in order of oldest to newest created
You can select any image from your phone gallery and attach it to a comment or a new topic.\n
Select any point on the map and press the submit button to attach it to your comment or new topic. You can zoom in and out with the buttons at the bottom of the map.\n
Here you can view all the topics and comments that you saved as a favourite. Topics and comments saved here will be updated whenever they are changed automatically.\n
What does the -Map Thread- button do?

The map thread button shows you a map and displays a marker for every comment location in the current topic, indicating where that comment was posted or what location it is referencing. The different coloured marker is where the topic was posted.\n
But I don't want my location posted for everyone to see!

Locations are a very important part of the app, but it is understandable to not want locations such as your home displayed for everyone to see. There are two options to remedy this. The first is to turn off the gps on your phone which will set your default location to (0,0), the middle of the ocean. The second way is to edit your location when creating a topic or comment by clicking the marker icon and then selecting a random location on the map.\n
I accidentally submitted a comment with a location I didn't want

Go to where your comment was posted and click the edit button. Select the marker to open the map and select a new location. Once submitted, this will overwrite the previous location associated with the comment.
